U.S. Congressmen Criticize Bush 
    Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- Ten U.S. congressmen sent a message to President Bush in protest against the cancellation of their planned visit to the DPRK due to the objection of the administration, according to AP.
 They in the message complained about the "arrogant and discourteous treatment" they received from Bush's aide team and dismissed the action taken by the president to cancel the planned visit of the group of suprapartisan congressmen to north Korea as wrong.    
 They proposed to meet the president to discuss the issue of their visit to the DPRK.

Congratulations to Malaysian Prime Minister
    Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Pak Pong Ju sent a congratulatory message to Datuk Seri Abdullah Ahmed Badawi upon his election as prime minister of Malaysia.
 Expressing the belief that the favorably developing relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would as ever grow stronger and develop in the interests of the two peoples, the message wished him great success in his responsible work.

Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Icelandic Ambassador
    Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Eidur Gudnason, new Icelandic ambassador e.p. to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 Present was Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs.    
 After receiving the credentials, the president conversed with the ambassador.
